file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-56-05-04 - INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove and install the inboard and outboard flap lower shrouds rubber seal. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER ALL 57-56-05-000-801-A SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - REMOVAL INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER ALL 57-56-05-400-801-A SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - INSTALLA- TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-56-05 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-56-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the rubber seal of the inboard and outboard flap lower shrouds. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS AMM TASK 57-56-01-000-801-A/400 - REMOVAL SRM 51-40-02-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 5711 Inboard flap lower shroud 6711 Inboard flap lower shroud 5721 Outboard flap lower shroud 6721 Outboard flap lower shroud D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic Spatula To remove the sealant available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-56-05 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE On the inboard and outboard flap lower 1 Does the task shrouds I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Remove the flap lower shrouds (AMM TASK 57-56-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Put the flap lower shrouds on a safe surface to prevent damage. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the flap lower shrouds rubber seal as follows: (a) Remove the solid rivet, according to (SRM 51-40-02-PR). (b) Remove the support, as applicable. (c) With an acrylic spatula, remove the sealant from under the rubber seal along the contour. NOTE: Look to know the correct position of the sealant. This will help you during the installation procedure. (d) Slowly release the rubber seal with an acrylic spatula until the rubber seal is fully removed from the flap lower shrouds. (e) Remove the old sealant from along the contour of the flap lower shrouds. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING. DO NOT BREATHE THE SOLVENT GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (f) Clean the surface with a cloth wet with isopropyl alcohol. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-56-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS RUBBER SEAL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the rubber seal of the inboard and outboard flap lower shrouds. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION INBOARD AND OUTBOARD FLAP LOWER SHROUDS AMM TASK 57-56-01-400-801-A/400 - INSTALLATION IPC 57-56-00 FLAP SHROUDS SRM 51-20-01-PR - SRM 51-40-02-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 5711 Inboard flap lower shroud 6711 Inboard flap lower shroud 5721 Outboard flap lower shroud 6721 Outboard flap lower shroud D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic Spatula To install sealant available Commercially Cutter To install the rubber seal available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Silicone sealant - RTV 157 (Gray) AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-56-05 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Flap Shrouds IPC 57-56-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE On the inboard and outboard flap lower 1 Does the task shrouds I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the flap lower shrouds rubber seal as follows: (a) Prepare the parts of the flap lower shrouds to which RTV-157 sealant will be applied. (b) Apply a thin coat of RTV-157 sealant along all vent door contour where the rubber seal will be installed. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR for the curing time. NOTE: The sealant curing time changes with the environmental conditions. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. (c) Install the flap lower shrouds rubber seal. NOTE: Clean the excess sealant. (d) Push your finger against the seal to install it correctly. (e) Put the support in position, as applicable. (f) Install the solid rivet, according to (SRM 51-40-02-PR). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the flap lower shrouds. (AMM TASK 57-56-01-400-801-A/400).
